subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution—summary. To date, 41 species in the genus
Dienerella
have been described worldwide—19 from the subgenus
Cartoderema
and 22 from the subgenus
Dienerella
. Most of the species from this genus are distributed in three zoogeographic realms: the Palaearctic (29), Neotropical (13) and Nearctic (8). The largest number of species from the subgenus
Cartoderema
occur in Europe (13) and North Africa (7), while the species from the subgenus
Dienerella
occur mainly in Asia (12) and the Neotropical realm (11) ( Tab. 1 ). Species from the subgenus
Dienerella
have at least one representative in each geographical realm of the world, in contrast to
Cartoderema
species, which have not been reported from the Australian or Oriental realms.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Number of taxa in the genus
Dienerella Reitter, 1911
divided into the subgenera
Cartoderema
and
Dienerella
, distributed in all zoogeographic realms.
